intro: Bufonia kotschyana subsp. kotschyana, commonly known as the Kashmir spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky latex sap. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Bufonia kotschyana subsp. kotschyana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
